did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: This collection contains newspaper articles about the town of East Lyme, Connecticut and vicinity. It was compiled over the years by the staff of the East Lyme Public Library.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: East Lyme, Connecticut was incorporated as a town in 1839, formed from parts of Lyme and Waterford. It includes two villages, Flanders in the northern part of town and Niantic along the coast.
The newspaper clippings were systematically saved by the East Lyme Public Library staff over a period of years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The clippings in this collection document events and people in the East Lyme area, including obituaries. Also documented are schools, businesses, institutions, and politics. They date from 1910 to 1995.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The notebooks are numbered and are in chronological order. There is a card file index of the clippings.
